doc.after: Italy's official language is Italian.[164] It is estimated that there are about 64 million native Italian speakers[165][166][167] while the total number of Italian speakers, incluiding those who use it as a second language, is about 85 million.[168] Italy has numerous regional dialects,[169] however, the establishment of a national education system has led to decrease in variation in the languages spoken across the country during the 20th century. Standardisation was further expanded in the 1950s and 1960s thanks to economic growth and the rise of mass media and television (the state broadcaster RAI helped set a standard Italian).
